msbt.message: I was just thinkin' about which sport I should choose for my pro debut.

Soccer seems like a good pick I think I'd be pretty good at it.I'd move the ball downfield with fancy footwork, and then SCOOORE!Then I'd tear off my shirt, show off my ripped bod, and work the fans into a frenzy! Pretty good, huh?

Baseball feels right I think I'd be pretty good at it, .With the fans cheering me on, I'd blast a home run so far that it might leave the solar system!I'd cross home plate, rip off my jersey, flex my abs, and make the crowd go wild! Pretty cool, huh?

Basketball might be the way to go I'm pretty sure I'd be great at it.I could sink that clutch three-pointer at the buzzer from across the court to win the championship, no prob!Then I'd tear off my jersey, strike a few muscle-man poses, and flex as the crowd rushes the court!

Are you ready for sportswear? It's totally based on science and stuff!Picture thisT-shirts with drawings of a bunch of buff muscles on them.Anybody can get a ripped bod just by putting on a T-shirt! It's like a dream, right? !

It's time to show off all the finger muscle I've been building! I'm gonna get some finger gloves! Hang on If everyone sees how buff my fingers are, they'll totally ignore how huge my arms are!Ha! Never mind! Just forget I said anything, .

I was thinking about how swimming is the best sport for showing off the most musclesfor some folks. But when I go swimming, I always wear a big life jacket and some arm floaty things, .Hey, do you know if anyone makes floaty things that show off muscle instead of hiding it?
When it comes to sports knowledge, I'm your guy!

For instance, folks look super cool when they're wearing jousting gear.It's the fact that they're all dressed up in medieval fighting gear, right?But those outfits kinda stink on the inside. It's like, "Medieval times are over! Clean your gear!"
Like how "freestyle" swimming isn't really "freestyle" at all, . Found that out the hard wayI took a bunch of floaty stuff with me to the training pool, and everybody yelled at me.
Did you know that the euphoria you get after a long run is called a "runner's high"?Just like the feeling you get after a thousand pole-vaults in a row is called a "pole-vaulter's high."
But you look like the type who'd rather work out than hear about working out. Ha! Me too!
Hey, do you know the most important necessity for wilderness survival?
It's your pecs! If you wanna survive out in the wild, you gotta have buff pecs!
It's your biceps! If you wanna survive out in the wild, you gotta have huge biceps!
It's your hamstrings! If you wanna survive out in the wild, you gotta keep your hamstrings in shape!

They say that inner strength dwells in the toughest muscle. You've heard that, right?A heart sitting behind solid pecs won't break during survival conditions, In other words, your chest muscles are the most important ones!

Out in the wild, you've gotta carry a lot of heavy things and maybe swim in rough waters, right?You gotta have faith in your own armsIn other words, your arm muscles are the most important for survival.

I'm not talking about a new kind of string, I'm talking about the muscles behind your thighs, !Out in the wild, if you can run fast, you can survive.In other words, those leg muscles are the most important ones out in the wilderness.
I thought of a cool sportsmanship oath. Listen up, .
Embrace tomorrow's soreness! Fight for it, like your team captain, !Actually, I don't know how often you'd use that.
Go on a fun field trip! Skip everywhere! Never stop flexing!Um I guess it needs a little work.
We athletes vow to apply hot compresses and use sports cream when our muscles get sore!Hmm Needs a little more of a sportsy attitude, .
I've been thinking I haven't been specific enough when I tell you that your abs are awesome.
Take your rectus abdominis, for instance. Those are the muscles right in the middle of your stomach.And yours are amazing! That six-pack of yours is REALLY coming along. Way to go, !
Like your transverse abdominis! That's the inner ab muscle that supports your lower back.As smoothly as you move around, yours has gotta be amazing. Maybe not everyone sees it, but I do!
Like those amazing obliques of yours. Those are the muscles on your sides, beneath your arms.I don't say this to everyone, but your posture is awe inspiring. So, way to work those obliques, !
You know what? I think you're ready to learn one of my most powerful training secrets

It's gonna sound weird, but just go with me here. First, face the ocean. Take a deep breath. And thenShout something inspirational at the top of your lungs!I LOVE MY MUSCLES!Or, y'know, something like that. Use this technique wisely! It's more powerful than you can imagine.

It's so simple, you're gonna laugh when I tell you. It's just stretching!Even the most shredded muscles need to get stretched out before they can deliver peak power.But here's the trickâ€”do an active warm-up BEFORE you stretch. Your muscles will thank you later!

One word.<10_4 /> Meditation!You might think I'm in the gym all day, but really I spend lots of time visualizing instead.I clear my mind of everything but the vision of my own muscles glistening in the sunTry it sometime! Er, with your own muscles, .
